snippet: The sealed vials were discovered on July 1 in a Food and Drug Administration lab at the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md., and were later confirmed to be smallpox.
abstract: Six sealed vials of smallpox virus, appearing to date from 1950s, are discovered in storeroom in a Food and Drug Administration lab in Bethesda, Md; officials report no exposure risk to lab personnel or public, and vials will be safely destroyed once testing is concluded.
lead_paragraph: The sealed vials were discovered on July 1 in a Food and Drug Administration lab at the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Md., and were later confirmed to be smallpox.

headline.main: Six Vials of Smallpox Discovered in Laboratory Near Washington
headline.print_headline: Six Vials of Smallpox Discovered in Laboratory Near Washington
